intro: Calothamnus aridus, commonly known as the desert bottlebrush, is a shrub native to arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive bottle-shaped stems and bright red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand prolonged droughts. Calothamnus aridus plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for native pollinators.
